articles.headline: Comedian Says Minnesota Run Is a Serious One
articles.snippet: Al Franken, the former “Saturday Night Live” star, is performing a balancing act as he runs for the U.S. Senate.
articles.abstract: Al Franken, the former “Saturday Night Live” star, is performing a balancing act as he runs for the U.S. Senate.
articles.lead_paragraph: ST. PAUL  Even as Al Franken stretches out his big doughy hand to another potential voter inside Nina’s Coffee Cafe on a recent morning, it is easy to forget that Mr. Franken, the former “Saturday Night Live” star, the satirist and author, the liberal radio host, is trying to be elected to the United States Senate.

articles.headline: Two Insurers Increase Bet on Medicare
articles.snippet: UnitedHealth and Humana are gambling heavily on Medicare Advantage — a program that has become a political target.
articles.abstract: UnitedHealth and Humana are gambling heavily on Medicare Advantage — a program that has become a political target.

articles.headline: Activision’s Chief Looks for Gaming’s Next Moves
articles.snippet: As Activision prepares to join forces with Vivendi Games, its chief executive faces an industry in transition.
articles.abstract: As Activision prepares to join forces with Vivendi Games, its chief executive faces an industry in transition.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 4  Guitar Hero III, a video game sweeping the nation like a Top 40 tune, lets players strum along on a toy plastic guitar to rock songs played on a television screen. It is attracting a wide audience: children, teenagers, 40-somethings, even the elderly.

articles.headline: In Japan, Rural Economies Wane as Cities Thrive
articles.snippet: Since the 1990s, a growing economic disparity has emerged between prosperous cities and depressed rural areas.
articles.abstract: Since the 1990s, a growing economic disparity has emerged between prosperous cities and depressed rural areas.
articles.lead_paragraph: NOSHIRO, Japan  The only outward sign of conflict here is the red flags of protest, but this small logging city on Japan’s remote northern coast is seething.

articles.headline: Fund Crisis in Florida Worrisome to States
articles.snippet: The sudden flight from a Florida investment pool points to a broader uncertainty among officials in other states over how far the credit and mortgage crisis might spread.
articles.abstract: The sudden flight from a Florida investment pool points to a broader uncertainty among officials in other states over how far the credit and mortgage crisis might spread.
articles.lead_paragraph: Top Florida officials moved yesterday to stabilize an investment pool for local governments after a multibillion-dollar run prompted the state to temporarily suspend withdrawals by cities and school districts.

articles.headline: China’s Turtles, Emblems of a Crisis
articles.snippet: The saga of the last two Yangtze giant soft-shells is symbolic of the threatened state of wildlife as a result of pollution, hunting and rampant development.
articles.abstract: The saga of the last two Yangtze giant soft-shells is symbolic of the threatened state of wildlife as a result of pollution, hunting and rampant development.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHANGSHA, China  Unnoticed and unappreciated for five decades, a large female turtle with a stained, leathery shell is now a precious commodity in this city’s decaying zoo. She is fed a special diet of raw meat. Her small pool has been encased with bulletproof glass. A surveillance camera monitors her movements. A guard is posted at night.

articles.headline: Plan to Build Reactors Is Running Into Hurdles
articles.snippet: With early jockeying under way to win U.S. government approval for a new generation of nuclear reactors, ominous signs are emerging that the plans may not go smoothly.
articles.abstract: With early jockeying under way to win U.S. government approval for a new generation of nuclear reactors, ominous signs are emerging that the plans may not go smoothly.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  For the first time in three decades, companies are getting ready to build nuclear reactors in the United States. They intend to do so under streamlined procedures meant to avoid the long delays and cost overruns that crippled the industry last time around.

articles.headline: A Calmer Iraq: Fragile, and Possibly Fleeting
articles.snippet: The reduced violence in Iraq in recent months stems from three significant developments, all of which can be reversed, and on relatively short notice.
articles.abstract: The reduced violence in Iraq in recent months stems from three significant developments, all of which can be reversed, and on relatively short notice.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD, Dec. 4  The reduced violence in Iraq in recent months stems from three significant developments, but the clock is running on all of them, Iraqi officials and analysts warn.

articles.headline: Something to Watch Over You
articles.snippet: G.P.S. has gone from its origins in military navigation to being a wildly popular consumer technology for finding one’s way from the airport to the hotel in an unfamiliar city.
articles.abstract: G.P.S. has gone from its origins in military navigation to being a wildly popular consumer technology for finding one’s way from the airport to the hotel in an unfamiliar city.
